titleStmt.title: Letter, James L. Dodds in Camp Laurel, Md., to Ellen Smith in Jackson, Tenn.,1918 Feb. 24

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, James L. Dodds in Camp Laurel, Md., to Ellen Smith in Jackson, Tenn.,1918 Feb. 24

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: I received your letter friday night and had begun to thank I would never here from you any more I was real glad to get it even if I did have to wait a long time
I am getting along fine and feel dandy all the time I thank this life agrees with Me for I feel so murch better than I did when I enlisted
The only thing that is rong with me Now I want to come home. But I dont thank they is any chance for me to get off from Camp
So guess I will have to let it
I am having lots of fun Now have been on the rifle range several times of late But they wont learn Me how to shoot I Miss the target about half the time

I have been shooting a mechine gun this morning I shot it 47 times and didnt hit the target at all "some shot" and the target is about 6 feet squar so I dont thank I will ever learn how to shoot the blooming thing
Guess you are still on the go, for the weather has been real nice here except a snow friday and it has most melted now I am not at all sorry of it either I thank I have had enough winter for a while
I have thought several time I would freeze but have always

Say did you get the picture I sent you you should have it by this time. Well what do you think of it? Say havent you got a little picture of some kind you could send me? one that will go in My card case I want to take it to France with Me.
Well what is going on in the little City? I guess there isnt murch only the shows But that is more than I get to see. I will tell the truth I havent been to a show since I left home
I wouldent know how to act if I should get a chance to go to one
I have been to one dance I thank I have told you about that But I didnt tell you about the little girl I met She sent me a box of candy the other day. Oh some girl As long as she will send the candy
Guess I will soon leave here and then I will go back to Laurel I thank And then away goes the girl and the candy Has Esther got married yet? Tell her will write her soon
I dont know any more to write so I will close for this time Write Me every thing you can thank of I like to here the news
